intro: Cynanchum aemulans, commonly known as Indian tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South and Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows up to 1 meter in height, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Cynanchum aemulans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in marshy areas or along riverbanks.
